lenders.name: melliecarma aka matthias
lenders.occupation: warehouseman by day, social investor by night...
lenders.loan_because:
i want to make a difference, wanna see the money go to real people, real (smiling =;-)) faces. it's a way for me to bridge cultures, lifestyles + religion.
.
.
.

i committed myself to granting at least one microloan a month through kiva. this commitment was made on the 4th of july, 2009, upon granting my first microloan to amanullah maqsood in afghanistan.
lenders.occupational_info:
unloading containers, trucks + trailers the whole day. it pays the cost of living but otherwise it's a pretty senseless  thing to do... so i need something to balance it out which brings me here...

drowning islands like the carterets, earthquakes like in haiti and mudslides like on madeira or in the cuzco region (aguas calientes) in peru raise the question for me: what am i doing here? where's the sense in that? what can i do to make the world a better place? part of the answer lies here...

in response to "the case of the faceless lender" i changed my avatar from cool rabbid to the actual one... it's from december 2006, but then i haven't changed that much...  i also added my first name (matthias) just in case "my" borrowers might be curious... =8-) you all are great people in my book! knowing that you exist makes my life worth living...! keep on fulfilling your dreams!

lenders.name: Mr. Biss

lenders.occupational_info: By introducing students to incredible people on the other side of the planet, I hope to open opportunities for entrepreneurs and for the students themselves.

lenders.name: Chile BBB 09
lenders.loan_because:
We're Team Chile from the Country in A Bag Activity and we want to be a part of this BIG idea from the BBB course at Erindale!   In our 2nd week of the BBB course we formed a "Partnership" and raised $25 between the two of us.  
Mr. BI$$ converted our hard currency (Canadian cash) into a kind of "soft" currency he called "Kiva Currency".   This was a kind of electronic certificate that enabled us to actually invest in our chosen entrepreneur that decided on after much reflection.
lenders.occupational_info: We're going onto University and we created a special fund to help do microloans through Kiva, during our class.   After the course is over we can continue to monitor our particular entrepreneur's repayment success.  We can then reinvest our funds in the months and years ahead or ask for our investment back.   We can even change our team name to our individual name(s) as we become working professionals and continue to invest under the BIG Idea banner - and watch other students learn as we did!

lenders.occupational_info:
Our NPO, Social Innovation Japan, is a non-profit organization founded in August, 2005 to promote “Social Innovation” (solving social problems by developing innovative social products & services and/or business processes to generate them) and cultivate “Social Entrepreneurs” while providing them with the open platform to expand their network.
Please visit our website http://www.socialinnovationjapan.org/c000011/

lenders.occupation: Starting my own business in the food industry
lenders.loan_because: It has been 4 years in the making and I need some funding to finish. I started my own business called Hummilicious. We make hummus, cheesecakes and crackers. We are set to launch in almost 25 stores to start, but need additional funding other than my own pocket.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a employed full time as I try to finance my business that I have started,  I am hard working, honest and enjoy meeting new people. The start of this business has been exciting for me. Although there is a lot of hard work involved I have met a lot of new people that I would  not have met otherwise. When I get to share my business with other's they can feel the excitement and energy as well. I have a staff set up in place worldwide due to meeting people these people at different places. Maybe you are the next person to become part of our growing to team. A small donation/ on lending hand  is all that is needed to be considered part of our team. Please help my dream become a reality. Lend a hand today!

I work with animals, mostly dogs. I cut their hair and see to their good hygiene. As silly as it seems, I even put bows in their hair and paint their toe nails! It is very hard work, but I do love it. 

I especially love to groom dogs who are considered 'bad'. It's a wonderful feeling when they allow me to handle them when they won't let anyone else. They are the ones who really need help and that's why they are so special to me.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: this is a loan in honor of my Dad for Father's Day 2009.  He is an  honorable,  kind,  supportive, generous, patient, tolerant and loving man who I adore with all my heart!
lenders.occupational_info: I help people fulfill their dream of owning a home or selling their home.

lenders.name: jacquelyn
lenders.occupational_info: I live below the poverty rate myself right now. I am a single mom of an 11 year old, and will graduate with a bsw in may of 2010. I am interested in many social justice issues. Having experienced many injustices related to poverty myself, I hope that I will be in a position to help others at some point. The poverty that I have dealt with is nothing compared to what a lot of other people in the world live with, but I do understand some of the powerlessness and lack of respect that many people experience. I have had countless demeaning and demoralizing experiences with the powers that be, right here in Buffalo New York. It will be great to have a decent job when I graduate, but I want to do something more than just go to work everyday and collect a paycheck. Wish me luck! Maybe someday in the future, I'll be able to help you turn things around for yourself too.

lenders.name: Victoria
lenders.loan_because: I am no longer loaning because of animal cruelty that is being supported on this site

lenders.name: Marc
lenders.loan_because: I see it as a great way to help people, and make an income that is considered small in my community do great things overseas. As a Christian, I believe in blessing and showing love to others. I also see microloans as a sustainable means of helping those in need.
lenders.occupational_info: I help small companies and business people increase awareness of their brand, create lasting impressions on potential clients and reach new prospects through print and digital mediums.

lenders.name: Ammar
lenders.occupation: Master degree of Nursing Services Administration

lenders.name: Ma. Leah
lenders.loan_because: i want to start again my business which  was left hanging due to lack of funds.
lenders.occupational_info: i am the administrative assistant of a convention center here in cebu.

lenders.name: Alexander & Bettina
lenders.loan_because: We are happy when we can support people to live their dream. Give the chance a chance.

lenders.name: Esther
lenders.loan_because: instead of buying more books, dvd's, clothes, shoes, make-up etc etc, which gives me only 5 minutes of happiness at the most, I'd rather loan it to someone who actually needs it.
lenders.occupational_info: I have a fun and interesting job which allows me to learn something new every day

lenders.name: Andy and Kirsten
lenders.occupational_info: I teach at International Schools.

lenders.name: Adam
lenders.occupational_info: United Kingdom

lenders.name: Silke & Rainer
lenders.loan_because: We live in a world of abundance nevertheless some people are not on the lucky side of life. Therefore, we want to support them to build up their individual dreams. With Kiva we get to know the people directly.
lenders.occupational_info: Scan and realize sustainable project ideas which are always based on people´s culture and tradition and their adaptation to modern life.

lenders.name: Juan Burton
lenders.loan_because: I loan because business ownership and entrepreneurship is my heart and passion, as well as my life. I support small business owners and entrepreneurs in general throughout the world and can relate in many ways.

lenders.name: Szilvia
lenders.loan_because: I believe poverty is strongly linked to poor health and that the alleviation of poverty in the world isn't the responsibility of a few people who do huge things, but the responsibility of everyone who can do small things. I also believe in hand ups as opposed to hand outs.

lenders.name: Rosemary
lenders.loan_because: I want to honour the life of our son Matthew who passed over in Feb 09
lenders.occupational_info: I manage a training organisation that provides training to people with a disability.

lenders.name: Ellen
lenders.occupation: Build Volunteer Manager - Habitat for Humanity

lenders.name: Dmitriy
lenders.occupational_info: On my work I'm help the small bisiness to grow...

lenders.name: Brian
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because: I would like to honor my Father who passed away in 2008.  He was a great gardener, carpenter, and cook who loved children and was always ready to help anyone in need.  My loans are made in memory of his loving and generous spirit.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a costume designer for the theatre and dance.  I hope that, through my work, I'm able to inspire, educate, or just entertain people.  I've been fortunate to travel around much of the world and have been humbled by my encounters with all of the amazing people I've met.

lenders.name: Cam
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed and because of a wondeful gift, I have been introduced to and given the opportunity to share with others through KIVA

lenders.name: Ron
lenders.loan_because: I understand how difficult it is to raise capital even in the best of times.
lenders.occupational_info: I help individuals and businesses get mortgages

lenders.name: St. Cyprian Church
lenders.loan_because: Our Lenten theme is One World, One Community,One Family.  In lending witrh Kiva we are assisted in living our  theme.
lenders.occupational_info:
"A Parish united to praise, worship,
and spread the word of the Lord,
by sharing the gifts that God has given us."
(Mission Statement 2005)

lenders.name: Hannie
lenders.loan_because: I care

lenders.name: moey
lenders.loan_because: Tiny acorns become mighty oaks.

lenders.name: Roxana
lenders.loan_because: I respect those who strive to support themselves and their families and make a decent living, wherever they are.

lenders.name: Richard
lenders.loan_because: I want to give many people a chance to do great things.
lenders.occupational_info: I wiork with students (6th and 7th grade) with social and emotional disabilities.

lenders.name: Kevin Duff
lenders.loan_because: I believe that we have a duty to serve the global good. We are the luckiest of the luckiest and should be obliged to help those less fortunate. We did not earn our life; we were born into it. Unlike us, the majority of the world is destitute, living in absolute poverty, without access to food, proper sanitation or clean drinking water. Our generation needs to put forth a bona fide effort to make change happen, to promote global equity. In years past, civilizations have been chastised for human rights atrocities: slavery, massacre, and imperialism to name but a few. Could our lack of action be just as wicked. Will we be likened to our historical malefactors, not for our evil actions but our blind apathy?
lenders.occupational_info: I just finished a masters degree in physiotherapy and will be working locally for a year before travelling abroad to work as a physiotherapist in low income countries. Afterwards, I plan on returning to school to pursue advanced training in Global Health.
